user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_linux_irq_shutdown:
```c
void metal_linux_irq_shutdown(void)
{
	int ret;

	metal_log(METAL_LOG_DEBUG, "%s\n", __func__);
	irq_handling_stop = true;
	metal_linux_irq_notify();
	ret = pthread_join(irq_pthread, NULL);
	if (ret) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to join IRQ thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
	}
	close(irq_notify_fd);
	metal_mutex_deinit(&irq_lock);
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function metal_linux_irq_shutdown:
static bool irq_handling_stop
...
static pthread_t irq_pthread
...
static int irq_notify_fd
...
static metal_mutex_t irq_lock
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
metal_log(METAL_LOG_DEBUG, "%s\n", __func__);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.8 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The call passes __func__ (a const char[]/const char *) and other values as arguments to metal_log; the fragment does not modify any function parameter. MISRA 17.8 prohibits modifying parameters inside a function (or reassigning pointer parameters), but merely passing arguments (including __func__) does not violate it. A hypothetical violation would be if metal_log internally reassigned one of its pointer parameters, which is not shown here.
